excerpt: "Technology doesn’t really take off until it reaches its ‘high-tech high-touch” stage — that is, it becomes accessible, friendly, and yes, fun, to users in a big way. That concept, spun by late author and futurist John Naisbitt in his seminal work Megatrends back in the 1980s,"
